page.title: 16Public house in Sissinghurst
page.content: The Bull Inn,owned by Whitbreads is the only public house in Sissinghurst. Despite local trade the pub relies heavily on the tourist trade in the summer season when two to three times the amount of trade is carried out. Selling food is as important as selling drinks.Without selling food the pub would not survive financially.A meal of and ham costs 2.25,with steak and kidney pie costs 2.75.Cheesecake&cream is 95p.Best bitter cpsts 95p per pint. Malt whisky 74p a measure.Red wine costs 70p per glass and lager on average is 1.00 a pint.Bitter and lager are mostly drunk.The pub has a garden,with facilities for young children.
